list_definition.definition: something which blocks every approach to a place by land or sea

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The blockade prevented supplies from entering the harbour/harbor.

list_ex_of_english: In the blockaded area the problem is much more difficult.
They blockaded their ports in the summer because of the pressures.
We are blockading ourselves to some extent and that cannot be allowed to go on.
We have heard today about thugs, bully boys and blockades.
We were told to-day there was no restriction on export to other parts of the world but the blockaded area.
Is it not a fact that the patrol has been one of the most successful naval blockades in history?
There have been tractors in the streets and blockades at the ports.
We advocated economic sanctions and naval and air blockades to enforce them.
